contacts.title: Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer
contacts.relevance_notes: CIO since November 2014. MBA from Pfeiffer University, BS from Gardner-Webb. Former President of HIMSS Virginia Chapter (2017-2018). Previously at UVa Health System and Hospital Partners of America. Leads digital transformation and AI integration initiatives. Key stakeholder for Epic training technology decisions.

contacts.title: Senior Vice President and CMIO
contacts.relevance_notes: CMIO since June 2010. Physician leader bridging clinical and IT perspectives. Key decision maker for Epic clinical workflows and training requirements. Critical stakeholder for EHR training content and delivery decisions.

contacts.title: Director, Education & Organizational Development (EPIC Training)
contacts.relevance_notes: Director since February 2018. Master's from Virginia Tech, BA from Concord University. Previously Manager of Education & Organizational Development (2008-2018) and Epic Principal Trainer (2007-2008). 17+ years at Carilion with deep Epic training expertise. Primary owner of Epic training program strategy and LMS decisions. Key stakeholder for virtual training initiatives.

contacts.title: Strategic and Education Partnerships
contacts.relevance_notes: Director of Workforce Development since June 2020. BS from Virginia Tech. Also serves as President of Blue Ridge Partnership for Health Science Careers. Previously VP at BrandAlliance and Owner of PerformanceLink. Quoted in media about workforce development strategy: 'We've concentrated on our recruiting, our internal training, working more closely with our school systems.' Key stakeholder for workforce training initiatives.

contacts.title: Director, Human Resources, Clinical Education
contacts.relevance_notes: Director since April 2022. Master's from Radford University, Bachelor's from Chamberlain College of Nursing, Associate from Wytheville CC. Previously Market Director Clinical Professional Development at HCA Healthcare (2019-2022) and Director Clinical Education at LewisGale Hospital. Clinical nursing background with Magnet program experience. Owns clinical education programs - key stakeholder for clinical training content.

contacts.title: Director, Clinical Informatics
contacts.persona_match: IT/Learning Technology Manager - Clinical Informatics Director
contacts.relevance_notes: Director since January 2019. BSN from Jefferson College, AAS from Virginia Western CC. 33+ years at Carilion progressing from Project Manager to Director. Long tenure provides deep institutional knowledge. Key technical contact for Epic workflow optimization and clinical informatics training requirements.

contacts.title: Senior Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer
contacts.relevance_notes: CHRO since November 2016. Bachelor's from Old Dominion University. Previously VP HR at Dignity Health (2013-2016) and Amerigroup (2011-2013), AVP & Chief HR Officer at University of Miami Medical Center (2003-2011). Owns HR strategy including workforce development and training. Executive sponsor for learning technology investments.

contacts.title: Associate Chief Medical Information Officer & Family Medicine Physician
contacts.relevance_notes: Associate CMIO since January 2024. DO from West Virginia School of Osteopathic Medicine, BS from UNC Wilmington. 12+ years at Carilion with progression from Family Medicine Resident to Medical Informatics Fellow to Physician to Associate CMIO. Also Assistant Professor at VTC School of Medicine. Bridges clinical practice and informatics - understands end-user training needs firsthand.

contacts.title: Senior Vice President, Chief Nursing Officer
contacts.relevance_notes: CNO since July 2025. MSN from Walden University in Leadership and Management. Previously Senior Director OB/GYN at Carilion (2011-2025). As CNO, oversees largest training population (nursing staff). Key stakeholder for clinical training priorities and nursing competency requirements.

contacts.title: Senior Director, Graduate Medical Education
contacts.relevance_notes: Senior Director since December 2014. MBA holder. Oversees 25+ accredited residency and fellowship programs. Key stakeholder for physician and trainee education, including Epic training for residents and fellows.

contact_summary.decision_maker_coverage: Excellent - CIO, CMIO, CNO, CHRO, Epic Training Director, Clinical Education Director, Workforce Development Director, Clinical Informatics Directors, Medical Education Director
contact_summary.recommended_entry_point: Jamie Hypes (Director, Education & Organizational Development - EPIC Training) - owns Epic training program directly. Keith Perry (CIO) - owns IT strategy including digital transformation. Cynthia Lawrence (Workforce Development) - owns workforce training initiatives and quoted in media about training strategy.

discovery_notes: Outstanding contact coverage across all target personas for EHR training. Jamie Hypes is the ideal primary contact as she owns Epic training directly and has 17+ years of Epic training experience at Carilion. Keith Perry as CIO leads digital transformation including AI integration that CEO Arner champions. Stephen Morgan as CMIO bridges clinical and IT for Epic workflows. Cynthia Lawrence leads workforce development and is publicly quoted about training initiatives. Christy Sutphin brings recent HCA Healthcare clinical education experience. Richard Truxillo as Associate CMIO provides physician informaticist perspective. Strong C-suite coverage with CHRO (Hudgins) and CNO (Franklin) for executive sponsorship. Rhonda Miller oversees medical education for 25+ residency programs.
